intro: Sebastiania virgata var. bidentata, commonly known as the bidentate sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, palmate leaves. It produces red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a thick, waxy coating. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
